intro: Galium serpenticum subsp. puberulum, commonly known as the pubescent wood sorrel, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which provide a distinguishing feature from other Galium species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is often found in association with other herbaceous flora in its native habitat.
